projects.title: hogspot mobile app
projects.desc: Developing an Android application that allows users to play a game similar to Geogussr. The app will use Google Maps API to generate a random location on UARK campus, and the user will have to guess where they are. The app will keep track of the user’s score and display it at the end of the game. A one-player and two-player mode will be available. Made with Kotlin in Android Studio.

projects.title: UARK PQC app
projects.desc: Creating a web app using Next.js and Supabase to allow researchers to use the UofA’s cryptography equipment for side channel attacks. The app will allow users to upload their own traces, select the algorithm they want to test, and view the results of the leakage test.

projects.title: spotify app
projects.desc: Developing a Next.js application that reworks the UI of Spotify, offering a more simplistic, minimal approach with Tailwind. Leveraging Spotify's API to fetch songs and albums, displaying top songs and a custom media player. Currently implementing OAUTH 2.0 to enable users to play albums / playlists backwards, and display their top 10 albums of all time.

projects.title: notion app
projects.desc: Recreating Notion’s award-winning note-taking app from scratch. Added page routing, improved shortcuts and currently working on code and equation blocks. Made with Next.js.

projects.title: nfl app
projects.desc: Utilizes NFL’s API to populate our database. Prompts users to enter SQL queries to update, delete, + view the DB. Made in React + Next.js

projects.title: portfolio app
projects.desc: This is my web-app. It’s pretty cool! Have you seen the Figma for it? This app displays a list of projects I’ve worked on or am currently working on. An about page is included. Made with React + Vite.

about.title: ACM VICE PRESIDENT
about.desc: I am the ACM vice president for The University of Arkansas’ RSO. During my time in the role, I have helped host various events, including meet the professors, where students can delve into UofA research, social and networking events, and this past annual 2024 HogHacks Hackathon, where over 200 students worked in teams to present their innovative projects to a panel of judges. I am currently working on planning events for the upcoming school year, along with leading a team of developers to help remodel the UofA’s ACM website.

about.title: PQC Undergrad Research
about.desc: As a part of my undergraduate honors research, I worked under Dr. Nelson of the University of Arkansas to conduct side channel attacks on post-quantum crypto-graphic algorithms. Utilizing a ChipWhisperer and UFO board, I was able to test the safety of two encryption algorithms using Test Vector Leakage Assessment (TVLA) and present my findings at the University of Arkansas Honors Symposium. Currently, I am creating a full-stack web applikcation that will enable researchers from across the globe to use the UofA’s PCQ equipment for leakage testing.

about.title: Biking + Running
about.desc: I enjoy riding on the trails of the Greenway, which extends four cities in Northwest Arkansas: from Bentonville, to Rogers and Springdale, ending in Fayetteville. I usually go 20-30 miles and savor the scenic routes. Recently, I took a mountain biking course, which has inspired me to continue riding dirt. Given that Bentonville is the mountain biking capital of the United States, I’m excited to continue learning and going on adventurous bike rides. This semester, I'm racing the Square 2 Square, starting in Bentonville and ending in Fayetteville. I am also training to run a half-marathon in December. Follow me on Strava!

about.title: Music
about.desc: I LOVE MUSIC. On average, I listen to music for around three to six hours each day. The best compliment I have ever received was that I have the most diverse, unique music taste. Hence, my Spotify wrapped always seems to be all over the place. Because of my love of music, I have interacted with Spotify’s API and created some pretty cool apps. Also, my favorite album is Un Verano Sin Ti.
